DataElement.preferredName: Stem Cell Transplant Treatment Protocol Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment schedule for the pre-clinical trial / therapeutic experiment describing the dosages of the drug and the times of the treatment.

Concepts.definition: A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 11/14/23 Released per PCDC-U of Chicago/Mei Li. BF;

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The transference of stem cells within the same individual.

Concepts.definition: Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is their own donor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.
